radiographic_examinations.findings: Coronary arteries and left ventricular function were completely normal.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms continued to deteriorate over the ensuing months.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No regional wall motion abnormalities despite occurrence of ST-segment depression and chest pain.
Transient ST-segment depression and chest pain detected, usually associated with tachycardia.
Exercise test was borderline positive, with up-sloping ST-segment depression but without chest pain.
